BodyName: Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Herbert Berman as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission and consider his designation as Chair.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Mr. Berman will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Jamila Ponton Bragg as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.   If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Ms. Ponton Bragg will serve an undefined term.

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Herbert Berman as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission and consider his designation as Chair.  If appointed, in conjunction with the Mayor, Mr. Berman will serve an undefined term.
Items.ActionName: P-C Item Approved by Committee with Companion Resolution
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be P-C Item Approved by Committee with Companion Resolution approved by Roll Call.
